intro: Galium biafrae, commonly known as African bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white to pale pink flowers, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Galium biafrae is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
